channel.title: [317] ::spec command help needed [Project Insanity]

item.title: [317] ::spec command help needed [Project Insanity]
item.dc:creator: @i_lex_50_i i lex 50 i
item.description:
@i_lex_50_i wrote:

well that was helpful… (changing it in the char file isn’t really the same now, is it?)

Anyways I figured out myself, yay!

If anyone else wonders, here’s the code (lol yeah, BASICS I know!):

if (playerCommand.startsWith("spec")) { c.specAmount = Integer.parseInt(playerCommand.substring(5)); }

Read full topic

item.title: [317] ::spec command help needed [Project Insanity]
item.dc:creator: @i_lex_50_i i lex 50 i
item.description:
@i_lex_50_i wrote:

ok guys, I couldn’t figure out how to make an owner command giving me the amount of spec bar i entered.

I.e. If I did ::spec 200, my spec bar would be 200.

If it’s of any interest, this is the command I got atm:

if (playerCommand.equals("spec")) { if (!c.inWild()) c.specAmount = 10.0; }
ALSO, there’s no need for the : “if (!c.inWild())” since this is only gonna be an Owner command

Thx in advance

Read full topic
